creator: albertcin@excite.com
text:
I had developed a daily rolling file appender (surprisingly similar to the one
now available in v1.1) for this I/O intensive project (a webapp w/35k average 
page size, running off JRun 3.0).  But I was seeing a terrible degradation in 
performance with 30 user loads.  Transactions which should've taken 6 seconds 
were taking 60!  Looking through the logs, I saw log4j entries which in the 
source code were mere cycles apart but in the log file appeared half a dozen 
seconds apart.

When we disabled log4j logging, the app became suddenly responsive.  When we 
implemented a quick and dirty file logger, it slowed down again.  When we 
wrapped the FileOutputStream in a BufferedOutputStream, it again became 
responsive.
I am totally convinced. Consider it done. Ceki
